posts.description: Meet Greg Rivera, Co-Owner of Mishka â€” Streetwear Plug
posts.extended: Mishka has grown into an internationally renowned brand. It's rebellious, unique image has appealed to people of various cultures. Their "bear mop" and eyeball logos have become iconic and they're one of the few brands staying true to their roots.

posts.description: What It's Like to Be a Hacker in Prison | VICE | United States
posts.extended: Life Inside is an ongoing collaboration between The Marshall Project and VICE that offers first-person perspectives from those who live and work in the criminal justice system. In 2010 Stephen Watt, a former software engineer, was sentenced to two years in federal prison and a $171.

posts.description: Kendrick Lamar's 'To Pimp a Butterfly' Is Noisy, Complicated, and Brilliant - The Atlantic
posts.extended: To Pimp a Butterfly is challenging, but that's because it reflects a challenging world. Six songs into his new album, Kendrick Lamar locks himself in a hotel room and faces a brutal assault from his own conscience.
